body:
@ianlancetaylor It's doing the opposite of importing. 

It is too similar syntactically to the the vast multitude of languages that have differential imports.  `import p.N`  looks like you're importing `N` from `p` into the local scope and not importing the rest of the package's symbols.

As mentioned above by @freeformz, imports are file scoped but this would be package scoped. 

It's confusing. I don't think there's any way to force this into imports that wouldn't be fundamentally confusing in some way.

I don't have a problem with the `var p.V` etc syntax.
